ACTIVITY.TITLE: Activity
ACTIVITY.SUBTITLE: The Three-Layer Design Model

STEP.DESCRIPTION:
Cisco's network design layered model contains three layers; core, distribution, and access. Each layer has a specific role and function.
In this activity, decide if the scenario describes the function of the access layer, core layer, or distribution layer.

An access control list is implemented to prevent unnecessary network traffic on the backbone network.
Is this an access layer function, core layer function, or distribution layer function?
When done, click the Check button.

A telecommuter connects to headquarters through a modem connection.
Is this an access layer function, core layer function, or distribution layer function?
When done, click the Check button.

Two main offices are connected over a T1 connection.
Is this an access layer function, core layer function, or distribution layer function?
When done, click the Check button.

2900 switches are being used to connect end users to the network.
Is this an access layer function, core layer function, or distribution layer function?
When done, click the Check button.

Catalyst 6000 switches are being used for inter-vlan routing.
Is this an access layer function, core layer function, or distribution layer function?
When done, click the Check button.

Two sites are being connected and the main goal is fast packet switching. No packet filtering or manipulation is desired.
Is this an access layer function, core layer function, or distribution layer function?
When done, click the Check button.

OSPF is the routing protocol and route summarization is to be implemented.
Is this an access layer function, core layer function, or distribution layer function?
When done, click the Check button.
